author: Sam Schechner
title: France Targets Apple, Google for ‘Abusive Commercial Practices’ - WSJ
text:
PARIS—France wants to fine Apple Inc. and Google for allegedly taking advantage of smaller French software developers, targeting two of the U.S.’s biggest companies, as tensions heat up between the two continents after President Donald Trump said he would adopt new tariffs that could hit European firms. 

The French Finance Ministry said Wednesday it has filed a complaint asking a Paris court to order Apple and Google, a unit of Alphabet Inc., to end “abusive commercial practices” following a three-year government investigation...
